meanings.definition: To cut open and spread apart (a piece of meat) to resemble the wings of a butterfly.
meanings.sent1: She butterflied the chicken breast before grilling it.
meanings.sent2: The chef butterflied the steak for faster cooking.
meanings.sent3: The butcher playfully butterflied the pork chop for the customer.
meanings.sent4: The surgeon skillfully butterflied the fish to remove the bones.
meanings.sent5: The cooking show demonstrated how to butterfly a pork loin.

meanings.definition: To split open and spread apart (a shrimp) to resemble the wings of a butterfly.
meanings.sent1: He butterflied the shrimp before adding it to the stir-fry.
meanings.sent2: The seafood restaurant often serves butterflied prawns.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman jokingly butterflied the shrimp to scare his friend.
meanings.sent4: The chef creatively butterflied the shrimp for the sushi dish.
meanings.sent5: The cooking class taught how to butterfly shrimp for tempura.
